revised_title: Feodor Lynen: A Pioneering Biochemist and His Impact on Science
tldr: This article is a biographical memoir of Feodor Lynen, a prominent German biochemist who made significant contributions to the understanding of fatty acid metabolism and enzyme mechanisms. Lynen's work earned him the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1964. The article highlights his life, education, scientific achievements, and personal qualities that made him an influential figure in the world of science.
